subject: Business
title: Lean Manufacturing: Eliminating Waste
description: A micro-lesson that makes Lean Manufacturing: Eliminating Waste usable.

hook.text: Toyota produces more cars with fewer defects using less space than any other automaker.

buildup.text: Lean identifies seven wastes: overproduction, waiting, transport, overprocessing, inventory, motion, and defects.

discovery.text: Any activity that doesn't add value from the customer's perspective is waste â€” and a target for elimination.

twist.text: Lean isn't about cutting staff. It's about making processes so efficient that the same people produce more value.

climax.text: Virginia Mason Medical Center applied lean principles from Toyota. Patient wait times dropped 50%.

punchline.text: Do more with less. But start by removing what adds nothing.

quiz.question: How many types of waste does lean manufacturing identify?
